intro: Meryta macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited meryta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly found in areas like Tonga and Samoa. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The fruit is a distinctive, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
